about_question_1_description: This service is provided by Emercoin Partnership
about_question_2_description: The managing partner and the author of the project is Oleksii Konashevych
about_question_3_description: Online service is purposed to satisfy the demand for integrity protection of digital assets (files and media), timestamp and authorship with the help of the blockchain technology
about_question_4_description: The service is addressed to an end user and can also be integrated into a business solution using API
about_question_5_description: The service can be used to sign contracts, to protect copyrights, for example, of photographers, writers, programmers, copywriters, researchers and inventors, for signing petitions, etc
about_question_6_description: The basis of the service is the technology of Emercoin platform, which started in 2014
about_question_7_description: It is based on the unique NVS technology, which not only saves user's data on the blockchain, but creates a special index field "Name" for quick search in the database, and "Value" field, where user can add any data and update it. At the same time the history of changes is preserved, because the blockchain cannot be altered. Also, the record that certifies copyrights can be transferred to another person (to another address).
about_question_8_description: Our mission is to provide a blockchain service for online digital signing of users' data, timestamping and authorship protection
help_question_1_description: Calculates the hash (checksum) of the file and sends it to the blockchain transaction. By fact, this is a digital signing of data
help_question_2_description: This service can be used to protect copyrights: a photographer, a scientist, an inventor, a programmer, a writer, a copywriter, a journalist, a blogger, a businessman. Just add a file with your materials: photo, documents, video, program, business plan. Also with the help of the service it is possible to conclude contracts, each party must sing the same file with the contract. You can also make a petition or vote for something.
help_question_3_title: What is the hash of the file?
help_question_3_description: This is a unique "serial number" or "fingerprint" of your data. Changing, at least one bit in the original file, you will get a completely different hash sum. Thus, having the hash sum in a safe place, you can always check the integrity of your data by matching it with your hash sum.
help_question_4_description: By signing your files on the blockchain: 1. You can check the integrity of data using the hash-sum that is permanently stored on the blockchain. 2. Timestamp - you can definitely check when was the publication of the transaction on the blockchain. 3. Protect the authorship, because the transaction is associated with the person who paid
help_question_5_description: The validity period is the period at which level the user can manage his record in the blockchain. Please note that this has nothing to do with the safety of the notarization. Recording in the locker is stored forever. Service NVS, developed on the platform Emercoin only extends records management capabilities. During this time, you can change the text field "additional information", extend the validity period or transfer the record to another user. At the end of this period, any other user can "pick" this record, and also start to manage it (but the history of all changes will still remain forever in the blockchain). All functions are not available yet, but we will notify you when you can use them.
help_question_6_description: Add a file you want to verify on the site. If the file is in the blockchain, you will see Name Value Service (NVS) entry. In the Name field there is a hash sum, in the Value field is user's data. If the user did not specify anything in Value, by default there will be a hash sum of the payer's e-mail address.
help_question_7_description: The authorship is proved by the connection between the payer and the blockchain entry. In fact, the service links the payment through PayPal e-mail to the transaction. By default, the hash sum of the email address is published. But users can open email, and they can add other data to the Value field when they notarize the file. For example, name, phone, URL link.
help_question_8_title: Is the file stored on the blockchain?
help_question_8_description: No, take care of your the security of your files. The service does not store files. Only hashes. You cannot restore the file from it.
help_question_9_description: No one, not even us. The hash sum is calculated locally on your PC, and the file never leaves your disk. So, to whom to transfer your file or from whom to save it, you take care of yourself.
help_question_10_title: Is it possible to determine by the hash sum what the file contains?
help_question_11_title: Is it possible to sign the same file twice?
help_question_11_description: Yes, the index number is added to the hash sum through the colon. When you search, you see all transactions for notarizing this file, starting from the first.
help_question_12_title: And how is the authorship protected then, if anyone can notarize the file any number of times?
help_question_12_description: Timestamp. This corresponds to the legal principle of proof of authorship. The one who can prove that he owned it first, he is the author. So, before submitting your materials to anyone or their publication, first sign your file on our service.
help_question_13_title: How else can legally copyright be protected?

verify_modal_info_title: Why hashing e-mail? Why add additional information?
verify_modal_info_text: Our robot loves cryptography. It takes your document and turns it into a single 32-digit string of letters and numbers.
verify_modal_open_email_description: Add your email in the blockchain publicly. By clicking it you agree that this data will be permanently stored on the blockchain and nobody can ever change it.
verify_modal_hash_email_description: Encrypt your email by casting only a hash sum of it
verify_modal_email_hashed_message: Please choose to encrypt or not to encrypt email.
